Project LO02 - Jest

© ZiYi XU and YanFeng QIU 2019 UTT

About this project

This project is a game, named "Jest". It is a little card game for 3-4 players, lasts for about 10 minutes, invented by Brett J. Gilbert. We use the rules v1.0, from www.goodlittlegames.co.uk.

The game contains 18 cards:

• 16 suit cards: Each of the 4 suits contains 4 cards: Ace, 2, 3 & 4. The Ace is a special card and can become a 5 in some circumstances.

• Joker: The Joker is here to cause trouble for the players: Watch out for him!

• Reference card: Shows the hierarchy of the suits and the ways in which the card combinations score.

Each game there are five stages :

  1. Set up
  2. Deal Cards
  3. Make Offers
  4. Take Cards
  5. End

In this project, we realized this game, so players can play it on the computer. There are two ways of interaction: command line and graphic user interface. And the players can see the results and process of the game on both the console and the graphic user interface.

We managed to separate the work load and work times, using a private repository on GitHub, we increased our efficiency.

Develop environments

We have developed the programme on two platforms: macOS(10.15.2) and Windows 10. Using softwares : Eclipse by The Eclipse Foundation and Visual Studio Code by Microsoft. All the source codes can be correctly compiled and run at those two environments above.

Packages 
Package Description
controller
The package controller containes two classes, the Starter and the GameController.
moteur
The package moteur containes the classes of Arbitre, Cards, CardsAJouer, CarteCouleur, CarteValeur, DrawDeck, InvalidNumberException, Jest, Observable, Offer, Player, PlayerReel, PlayerVirtuel, Stack, Trophie and Visitor.
moteur.strategy
Given the fact that a PlayerVirtuel should make the disicion like a humain do, at the meantime they should act differently according to the level of difficulity chosen before a game start, we use the Design Pattern Stragety to realize that.
Vue
Using the concept "VMP", this packages containes the views of the project.
